description: Borrowed from Punjabi ਕਿਰਪਾਨ (kirpān), from Sanskrit कृपाण (kṛpāṇa, “sword, dagger, sacrificial knife”), from कल्पयति (kalpáyati, “he orders, apportions, cuts, trims”).

entries.meaning: (Sikhism) A ceremonial sword that must be worn at all times by baptized Sikhs, and one of the five Ks.
